summary: Mr. O’Brien is an international development specialist with more than 30 years of experience in Southeast Asia, South Asia, Africa, and the Middle East. Technical work has revolved around the areas of environmental health, urban and regional economic development, community-based planning and participatory development, disaster response and mitigation, and complementary program monitoring and institutional learning. Mr. O’Brien has directly overseen the management of more than $200 million in contracts and grants from USAID, World Bank, UN Agencies, other bi-laterals, and private foundations. His management duties have involved: workplan development, proposal and new business development, contract negotiation, subcontractor management, operations and administrative management, results monitoring, personnel recruitment and supervision, financial management and accounting, high-value procurement and programmatic reporting. He has also led development of critical partnerships with a wide range of international organizations and private corporations. Mr. O’Brien holds a Master’s degree in Architecture and Urban Planning from UCLA.
